body_html:
In Ubuntu 16.04, I successfully compiled pytorch 0.5, with cuda9.2 + dudnn7.2 + gcc-4.9 + g++-4.9 on my laptop with nvidia870m which has compatibility 3.0. Just apt-get install gcc-4.9 and g++-4.9, no patching. I tried gcc5 in system but failed.

UPDATE:
Sadly, the version compiled by gcc4.9 is not work in cuda. So I just went back to use gcc-4.8 and follow the medium link. So far, everything is ok.
body_text:
In Ubuntu 16.04, I successfully compiled pytorch 0.5, with cuda9.2 + dudnn7.2 + gcc-4.9 + g++-4.9 on my laptop with nvidia870m which has compatibility 3.0. Just apt-get install gcc-4.9 and g++-4.9, no patching. I tried gcc5 in system but failed.
UPDATE:
Sadly, the version compiled by gcc4.9 is not work in cuda. So I just went back to use gcc-4.8 and follow the medium link. So far, everything is ok.
body:
In Ubuntu 16.04, I successfully compiled pytorch 0.5, with cuda9.2 + dudnn7.2 + gcc-4.9 + g++-4.9 on my laptop with nvidia870m which has compatibility 3.0. Just apt-get install gcc-4.9 and g++-4.9, no patching. I tried gcc5 in system but failed.

UPDATE:
Sadly, the version compiled by gcc4.9 is not work in cuda. So I just went back to use gcc-4.8 and follow the [medium link](https://medium.com/@Inoryy/compiling-pytorch-4-0-on-ubuntu-17-10-with-cuda-9-0-and-python-3-6-6769a0df56d5). So far, everything is ok.
